title: How to Have a Video Game Marathon

steps.headline: Figure out what day you will do this.
steps.description: Make sure you have nothing planned on. The easiest way is to pick a day you want, and ask your parents if you have anything planned. It is okay the reschedule.

steps.headline: Now that you have planned that out, it's time to figure out what games you will play.
steps.description: Pick some new ones and some old favorites, but be sure not to add too many.

steps.headline: Now figure out what you will do with the games.
steps.description: Pick which one you are going to play first. See which ones interest you most

steps.headline: Set the time you will start playing and the time you will stop.
steps.description: You can change these in the later steps if you have excess time or too less time. Try not to go over your bedtime.

steps.headline: Figure out how much time you will play each game.
steps.description: If you have too many games, remove some.

steps.headline: Get anything that can set an alarm.
steps.description: A DS (If you won't play with it during your marathon), some computer programs can do this (disable sleep), a cell phone or a regular alarm clock can do this.

steps.headline: Stay active.
steps.description: Sitting for long periods of time isn't good for your health. Get up and walk around the block every couple of hours.

text: Figure out what day you will do this. Make sure you have nothing planned on. The easiest way is to pick a day you want, and ask your parents if you have anything planned. It is okay the reschedule. Now that you have planned that out, it's time to figure out what games you will play. Pick some new ones and some old favorites, but be sure not to add too many. Now figure out what you will do with the games. Pick which one you are going to play first. See which ones interest you most Set the time you will start playing and the time you will stop. You can change these in the later steps if you have excess time or too less time. Try not to go over your bedtime. Figure out how much time you will play each game. If you have too many games, remove some. Get anything that can set an alarm. A DS (If you won't play with it during your marathon), some computer programs can do this (disable sleep), a cell phone or a regular alarm clock can do this. Stay active. Sitting for long periods of time isn't good for your health. Get up and walk around the block every couple of hours. Have fun!
